text: The astronomy of Meitei civilisation deals with celestial objects, space, and the physical universe as a whole. Meitei language term “Khenchanglon” () is derived from its ancient Meitei equivalent “Khenchonglon” (), literally meaning "the growing up, evolving or emergence of natural / celestial body(ies) and energy(ies)" and colloquially meaning "astronomy or astronomical bodies, like stars, constellations, planets, satellites, comets, meteors, etc." The Meitei astronomy was also related to the tradition of astrology. == Constellations == Constellations Romanisation English names Indo- Aryan/Sanskrit equivalents Number of stars Sajik Arietis Ashini Consisting of 3 stars Thaba II Arietis or Musca Barni Consisting of 3 stars Khongjomnubi Tauri or Pleiades Ktitika Consisting of 6 stars Apaknga 4th Lunar Masion Pauri II Ruhini Consisting of 5 stars Sachungtelheiba Orionis Mrigisera Consisting of 3 of 5 stars Ningthouturel Leonis or Regulus Magha Consisting of 5 stars Ningthousamu Leonis Parbaphalguni Consisting of 2 stars Samupicha Leonis II Utarphalguni Consisting of 2 stars Uphongngatu Carvi Hasta Consisting of 5 stars Mokang Virginis or Spica Chitra Consisting of 1 star Luwang Bootis or Arcturus Swati Consisting of 1 star Nanap Librae or Libra Bisaka Consisting of 2 stars Okpuroi Scorpii or Scorpionis Anuradha Consisting of 4 stars Taohuireng Scorpii or Scorpionis Antares Zestha Consisting of 3 stars Tongjengnubi Scorpii or Scorpionis Mula Consisting of 11 stars Thayai Sagittarii Parbasera Consisting of 2 stars Thaton Sagittari Utrasara Consisting of 3 stars Mani- Mamou Acquilae or Aquilee Sarbana Consisting of 3 stars Hareimaye Delphini Dhanistha Consisting of 4 stars Korounu Aquarrii Satbisa Consisting of 100 stars Khabaliteng Pegasi Purbadrabad Consisting of 2 stars Silpaleining Pegasi or Andromedae Utarbabrabad Consisting of 2 stars Yawakhuro Lunar Mansion Rebati
